answer: Net financial debt is calculated by adding long-term and short-term interest-bearing borrowings, the current portion of long-term financing obligations, all other non-current financial liabilities, and all current and non-current financial liabilities. Deductions include cash and cash equivalents, and all other financial assets that are not considered debt liabilities.
ground_truth: Sum of long-term borrowings, short-term borrowings, current portion of long-term borrowings, other non-current and current financial liabilities, minus cash and cash equivalents, minus other current and non-current financial assets; reported per ESMA Guideline no. 39 (2021-03-04), effective from 2021-05-05, and CONSOB Warning Notice no. 5/21 (2021-04-29)
